| History                 = 
===Hyborian Age===<!-- All stories written by [[Bruce Jones]]; if to be separated: [[Gypsies (Hyborian Age) (Earth-616)]] -->
[[Pendak (Earth-616)|Captain Pendak]] and his mercenary troop looted and pillaged on their way, posing as soldiers. One night, they attacked a Gypsy camp. Their leader, an old sorcerer begged for mercy, proposing to draw them a map to retrieve a treasure buried in the bed of a lake that would run twenty years later, but ended up tattooing parts of it on the mercenaries' arms didn't trusted each others with the map. Pendak tried to grab the sorcerer's daughter [[Lilane (Earth-616)|Lilane]], but one of Pendak's men, [[Bolar (Earth-616)|Bolar]] opposed him, and had his arm removed. The girl escaped and the mercenaries set fire to the Gypsy camp to slay all evidences and any witnesses. Surviving the ordeal and nursed by Lilane, he lost his mind but retained his memories and lusted for vengeance.<!--{{r|Conan the Barbarian #149}}-->

Afterwards, one of the mercenaries, [[Morlock (Gypsy) (Earth-616)|Morlock]], became the leader of a Gypsy group.{{r|Conan the Barbarian #149}} It is unknown if he was a Gypsy himself before taking the lead of the group.

[[Conan (Earth-616)|Conan]], while under the curse of the [[Ring of Jukas]] went to a Gypsy shack, hoping to find information about his curse, which he did.{{r|Conan the Barbarian #131}}

Conan later joined the travelling gypsy wagon of [[Grendl (Earth-616)|Grendl]]'s [[Grendl's Traveling Fighters (Earth-616)|Traveling Fighters]].{{r|Conan the Barbarian #137}}

Twenty years after, Bolar hunted down his former comrades, slaying Morlock. Conan, while travelling with the son of one of the mercenaries (slain little before), encountered gypsies in a funeral procession for him. In the end, all mercenaries were killed by Balor. Lilane revealed herself, and after Pendak was killed by Balor, only to be slain by Conan, Lilane adopted the boy.{{r|Conan the Barbarian #149}}
----
Some of the culture and language of the '''Romany''' came from the [[Zingarans]] and [[Zamorans]] of the [[Hyborian Age]].{{r|Marvel Premiere #12}}{{r|Blockbusters of the Marvel Universe #1|; [[Great Cataclysm]]'s entry}}

==18th century==
[[Cagliostro (O-Bengh) (Earth-616)|Cagliostro]], an olden king of the Gypsies, wrote the [[Book of Cagliostro]], detailing eons of magic knowledge. The book was passed down thru generations among Gypsies{{r|Marvel Premiere #12}} loyal to Cagliostro.{{r|Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe Mystic Arcana: The Book of Marvel Magic #1|; Tomes of Eldritch Knowledge, [[Book of Cagliostro]]'s entry}}<!-- 

==18th century-19th century==
possibly Pikeys --><!-- Gypsies living near [[Wollaston House]], in [[England]], two or three hundred years ago.{{r|Tower of Shadows #7|; The Scream of Things}}

When [[John Wollaston (Earth-616)|"Black John" Wollaston]] and his bullies came to kill them, and did kill [[Illenna (Earth-616)|Illenna]], her mother invoked the names of [[Marduk (Earth-616)|Marduk]], Ishtar and [[Hadad (Earth-616)|Baal]] to curse Wolaston and all who bore their violence.{{r|Tower of Shadows #7|; The Scream of Things}} -->

===20th century===
In 1935, nearby [[Schwartzhof]], [[Austria]], the [[Witch of the Hills (Earth-616)|Witch of the Hills]] used the spells of the [[Necronomicon|forbidden tome]] of [[Abd-el-Hazred (Earth-616)|Alhazred]], and summoned [[Lucifer (Earth-616)|Satan (Lucifer)]] on behalf of the [[Gypsies|Gypsy]] [[Lucio Nuti (Earth-616)|Lucio Nuti]] who wanted revenge over [[Baron Krutze (Earth-616)|Baron Krutze]] and his heirs, corrupt and tyrannous nobles who had destroyed his family.<!-- {{r|Monsters Unleashed #3|; The Death-Dealing Mannikin}} -->

The Roma, whether Muslim or Orthodox, suffered from the unrest and wars in [[Serbia]].{{r|Scarlet Witch Vol 2 11}}<!-- develop part on Maximoff -->

At the time of [[Pietro Maximoff (Earth-616)|Pietro]] and [[Wanda Maximoff (Earth-616)|Wanda Maximoff]]'s birth, the twins were adopted by fellow members of the tribe, [[Django Maximoff (Earth-616)|Django]] and [[Marya Maximoff (Earth-616)|Marya]], and lived with them until becoming teenagers. Tension between the Rom and neighboring [[Transia]]n villagers precipitated an assault on the travelers' encampment, resulting in Marya's apparent death and Django urging the twins to flee.{{r|Avengers #182}}{{r|Avengers #185|187}}<!--

[[Lilia Calderu (Earth-616)|Lilia Calderu, witch-queen of the Gypsies]], [[Living Gargoyle (Earth-616)|Living Gargoyle]].{{r|Marvel Premiere #12}} -->

==Religion==
In [[Serbia]], Romany included Muslims and christian Orthodox.{{r|Scarlet Witch Vol 2 11}}<!--

Some Roma are magicians,{{r|Scarlet Witch Vol 2}} pray to gods{{r|Tower of Shadows #7|; The Scream of Things}} and demons.{{r|Monsters Unleashed #3|; The Death-Dealing Mannikin}}
